messages.title: Building a stronger economy in a fairer society in Colchester
messages.content: Bob Russell and the Liberal Democrats want to build back by 2018, cut taxes for ordinary workers and bring in corporate controls for banks.

messages.title: Our record of delivery
messages.content: An £800 Income Tax cut for ordinary local workers, halved the deficit and helped businesses create 1.9m new jobs, Unemployment in Colchester down by 54% since 2010.

messages.title: Our promise of more
messages.content: Cut Income Tax by an additional £400 for low and middle income workers, Balance the budget by 2018, to bring down Britain's debt, More support for local employers and firms that provide paid apprenticeships.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cut taxes for ordinary workers, bring in corporate controls for banks, cut Income Tax by an additional £400 for low and middle income workers, balance the budget by 2018 to bring down Britain's debt.
Support for local employers and firms that provide paid apprenticeships.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour finished in a poor third place at the last election, more than 16,000 votes behind the Lib Dems. Labour can’t win - they’re priced as massive 50/1 outsiders! Voting for Labour here will just help the Conservative candidate sneak in.

issues.economy: Tax cuts for ordinary workers, corporate controls for banks, Income Tax cut by £400 for low and middle income workers, balance the budget by 2018.

leaflet.personalStatement: Campaigning locally, Bob has worked to stop closures and create jobs, with unemployment dropping below 4% in the last year. He is also proud of getting the Castle Bailey renovations underway. Bob Russell can beat the Conservatives here in Colchester.

contactInformation.address: Bob Russell, Magdalen Hall, Wimpole Road, Colchester, CO1 2DE

quotes.text: I'm backing Bob to deliver even more for Colchester. Bob’s work very hard for the people of Colchester... The best and hardest-working MP Colchester has had in my lifetime – maybe ever.

images.caption: Bob Russell - A record of delivery and a promise of more
